creator: jamestanit@yahoo.com
text:
--with-suexec-caller=UID
    The username under which Apache normally runs. This is the only user allowed to execute this program.

So the question is what EXACTLY is this? Not completely clear to a common user.
For example, execute "this" program, which program? suexec or apache? 

Is this the UID of the one SuexecUserGroup?

SuexecUserGroup xxx xxxx

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
Thanks for the report, fixed in trunk doc in r1029136.
